benchmark_details.name: LAiW
benchmark_details.overview: LAiW is the first Chinese legal LLMs benchmark designed to evaluate legal large language models (LLMs) based on the logic of legal practice. It categorizes legal capabilities into three levels: basic information retrieval, legal foundation inference, and complex legal applications, encompassing 14 tasks to ensure a comprehensive evaluation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of Chinese legal LLMs based on practical legal capabilities and highlight discrepancies between model performance and legal logic requirements.

data.source: Combines open-source datasets with proprietary legal data.
data.size: Various datasets spanning multiple legal tasks corresponding to 14 tasks in total.
data.annotation: Automated evaluation of LLMs and manual evaluations conducted by legal experts.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on standard evaluation measures for each legal task across automated and manual evaluations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment with the expectations of legal reasoning and logic as determined by legal experts.
methodology.baseline_results: Various LLMs evaluated against the benchmark, including GPT-4, ChatGPT, and specialized legal LLMs.
methodology.validation: Evaluation includes both automated and manual assessments to ensure reliability.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Sensitive legal data has been anonymized and ethical evaluations have been conducted by legal experts.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All datasets used are publicly available and have corresponding licenses.
